meanings.definition: To send or bring someone back to their own country.
meanings.sent1: The government repatriated the stranded citizens during the crisis.
meanings.sent2: The soldiers were repatriated after serving their time overseas.
meanings.sent3: The lost teddy bear was repatriated to its young owner, much to the child's delight.
meanings.sent4: The artist repatriated his paintings to the gallery after the exhibition.
meanings.sent5: The rescue team repatriated the injured hiker to safety, ensuring his return home.
